title: coverage: internal compiler error: regression on 20220702

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code This comes from Suricata coverage build on oss-fuzz : https://oss-fuzz-build-logs.storage.googleapis.com/log-adfe2312-62e1-4c25-a25b-221bfb9ed3e0.txt ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.64.0-nightly (f2d93935f 2022-07-02) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu ``` Was working with `rustc 1.64.0-nightly (46b8c23f3 2022-07-01)` cf https://oss-fuzz-build-logs.storage.googleapis.com/index.html#suricata ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'No counters provided the source_hash for used function: Instance { def: Item(WithOptConstParam { did: DefId(0:372 ~ minimal_lexical[4920]::stackvec::{impl#0}::capacity), const_param_did: None }), substs: [] }', compiler/rustc_codegen_ssa/src/coverageinfo/map.rs:156:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f48892feb40 - clone 37: 0x0 - error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.64.0-nightly (27eb6d701 2022-07-04) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C debuginfo=1 -C force-frame-pointers -Z instrument-coverage -C link-arg=-lc++ note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack ```

Can this be solved by fixing the warning: `-Z instrument-coverage` is deprecated; use `-C instrument-coverage` ?
